intro: Seseli glaucum, commonly known as blue seseli, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and the Balkans. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Its flowers bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Seseli glaucum is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
